text: Jessica Leigh Harp (born February 3, 1982) is an American songwriter from Kansas City, Missouri. She used to be a country artist. Between 2005 and 2007, Harp and Michelle Branch recorded and performed as The Wreckers. This group had a major success in 2006 with the Grammy-nominated "Leave the Pieces." After The Wreckers disbanded, Harp began a solo career on Warner Bros. Records, the same label to which The Wreckers were signed. Her solo second album single, "Boy Like Me," started in March 2009 and was a Top 30 hit on the U.S. Billboard Hot Country Songs chart. It was followed by her second album, A Woman Needs, in March 2010. ==Awards== Year Organization AwardAwards and nominations of Michelle Branch Result 2006 Country Music Association Vocal Duo of the Year (as The Wreckers) Academy of Country Music Top New Vocal Duo or Group (as The Wreckers) Academy of Country Music Top Vocal Duo (as The Wreckers) 2007 Grammy Awards Best Country Performance by a Duo or Group with Vocal â€” ("Leave the Pieces" as The Wreckers) Music Row Awards Major Label Breakout Artist of the Year (as The Wreckers) R&R Readers' Poll Best New Performer (as The Wreckers) Country Music Association Vocal Duo of the Year (as The Wreckers) Academy of Country Music Top New Vocal Duo or Group (as The Wreckers) 2008 Country Music Association Vocal Duo of the Year (as The Wreckers) ==References== ==Other websites== * The Official Site of Jessica Harp * The Official Site of the Wreckers Category:Warner Bros.
